It was hot, sunny and cloudless. The mermaids enjoyed spending days like these sunning themselves, chattering and gossiping on the huge rocks of Mermaid Lagoon, and several were relaxing when Karmilla arrived on her broom.

“Hey,” she greeted, observing them. There were four or five mermaids, pretty ones, in all: the first with short, blonde hair and blue eyes; the second with long, black hair and almond-shaped eyes; the third with medium, red hair and green eyes; the fourth with long, brunette hair and grey eyes.

“Hello,” they replied, regarding Karmilla with cautious eyes. Witches were distrusted by lighter creatures such as elves and pixies, which didn’t help in collecting ingredients ;;at all — in fact, it was a hindrance, as these creatures had powers of their own.

Nevertheless, the witch smiled. “I needed mermaid’s tears for my potion. Could you help me?” she asked.

At this point, however, she wasn't entirely certain she could back out at all, and was too scared of that possibility becoming confirmed to try just then. By way of a distraction, she tried to examine the interior of the rarely-visited fortress for anything that might be of use.

The bridewell's ceiling was high and vaulted over a cavernous entrance hall, only the few odd glimpses of the elaborate stonework visible in the shadows. The walls descended precipitously, racing the heavy chains of a few iron chandeliers on their descent to the marble expanse of the endless floor. Huge tapestries, fresh despite a no-doubt advanced age, cushioned he walls, providing a welcome backdrop for the erected suits of armour enshrined in alcoves beneath them. Occasionally, a vampire fluttered through, in human or bat form, rarely pausing to give Karmilla and her host more than a hungry glance as they went about their business. Despite the echo produced by the chamber's cyclopean scale, the room was eerily quiet and seemed open to the chill of the cold mountains outside.

"Where are we going?" Asked Karmilla, voice quiet in the preternatural chill. Already she wished she had something more extensive to cover herself with -a motion redoubled as vampires leered alternately at her exposed neck and belly. Even as she made the query, the vamp broke off the main hall and led her into a comparatively modest but even more luxuriantly furnished parlour.

Now confident that the witch wouldn't escape, she relinquished her death grip on the human's arm and slid her hand around the witch's slender waist instead. The parlour was narrow but long, with full-length windows overlooking a breathtaking mountain view lining one side and bookshelves the other. Comfortable divans, chairs, and tables formed neat squares periodically. The nearest one was occupied by two lounging vampires.

"What's this, Tania?" Asks one of the two corseted beauties, dense mane of raven curls falling over one ivory shoulder as she sits up eagerly. "A new toy?"
